notes.title: Notes
notes.p: Acknowledgments. The authors thank the pediatric accident and emergency ward staff of the Mulago hospital in Uganda for gathering the clinical information from the patient. We also thank the Mulago hospital staff, the pediatric research ward staff at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Malawi, and the pediatric staff of Kigali Central University Hospital in Rwanda for providing the samples used for the inflammatory biomarker analysis. We thank C. M. Kinsella for developing the bioinformatic pipeline.

Financial support. This work was supported by the Academic Medical Center (PhD scholarship to A. W. D. E.); the Platform for European Preparedness Against (Re-)emerging Epidemics project; the European Union Seventh Framework Programme (grant 602525; statistical methodology by C. C.); Host Switching Pathogens, Infectious Outbreaks and Zoonosis; the European Union Horizon 2020 Innovative Training Networks (grant 721367); and The Netherlands-African Partnership for Capacity Development and Clinical Interventions against Poverty-Related Diseases-Africa Research Initiative and Support program, sponsored by the Dutch Government (clinical study).

Potential conflicts of interest. All authors: No reported conflicts. All authors have submitted the ICMJE Form for Disclosure of Potential Conflicts of Interest. Conflicts that the editors consider relevant to the content of the manuscript have been disclosed.
